intro: Strobilanthes ramosissima, commonly known as the "flame of the forest," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that appear in clusters, giving it a vivid and eye-catching appearance. The plant belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and short blooming period, typically during the dry season. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a landscape plant.
